bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Memorandum from Tom E. Keys to Philip Showalter Hench, June 13, 1953

div1.p: Keys does not think that most of Reed's books offered for sale are valuable, except for one written by Holmes. He offers to contact book dealers for pricing information. However, Keys feels that Reed's autograph should increase the value of a book.

div1.head: Memorandum from Tom E. Keys to Philip Showalter Hench, June 13, 1953
div1.opener:
MEMO from the Desk of . . .
T. E. KEYS
__________________________________________________
To Dr. P. S. Hench
Date 6-13-53
SUBJECT:
Dear Phil:
div1.p:
I have looked this over and I don't
think the books on the enclosed
list are valuable, with the possible
exception of Professor at the
Breakfast-table by Oliver Wendell
Holmes. If you would like I would
be pleased to send the list to some
of the dealers in secondhand books
and ask if they would be interested
in quoting prices on them. Certainly
Walter Reed's autograph should help.
